127.heading: Carry.
127.title: The Comic Book Kids [videorecording]
127.author: producer, Sandra Turbow, Herb Silvers ; director, Gene Weed ; writer, Jim Engelhardt ; starring Joseph Campanella.
notes: CinemaKid Productions, 1986.
1 videocassette (ca. 60 min.) : s.d., col. ; 1/2 in.
VHS format.

Summary: "Burl Bonnix (Joseph Campanella) is the boss of Bonnix Comics. Marvin is his frustrated cartoonist and Carry and Skeets are two bright kids who have befriended Fantos, the comic book wizard. Fantos has given them magic belts with transporter rings. With a pull of the rings (pow) the kids are instantly in the comic strip scenes created by Marvin. Each episode is adventure packed and music filled. Comic books come to life with the Comic Book Kids."

138.heading: Carrying.
138.title: "Native Bearers"
138.author: Caz
notes: Wordless sequence of four drawings, in which a White man in a helmet instructs two Black men to put their burdens in his car, and then to pick up the car and carry it on their heads.

139.heading: Carrying.
139.title: "Never Ridicule Elderly People. You'll Be There Some Day!"
139.author: [No author]
notes: (Born Forty Years Too Soon)
Summary: Boys with shinny sticks poke fun at a passing couple of golfers. He is carrying two golf bags, and she has none.

140.heading: Carrying.

140.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: A successful raid makes Hagar almost forget his bad back, as Lucky Eddie carries an enormous sack.

148.author: [No author]

149.heading: Carrying On with Life.
149.title: "Nathan and Soirée Remain Glued to the TV Following the Terrorist Attacks on America"
149.author: by Glen Hanson and Allan Neuwirth.
notes: Summary: Sky tries to give blood but they won't take it because he's gay. Soirée feels trivial making clothes and performing in drag. Nathan says they have to carry on living their lives.

150.heading: Carrying Packages.

150.author: by Bud Blake.
notes: Summary: Stripe gets the job.

151.heading: Carrying People.
151.title: "Transportes Colectivos"
151.author: [No author]
151.series: Condorito) p. 27-28 in Condorito Gigante, no. 550
notes: There's a bus strike. Condorito and Garganta de Lata get the idea of carrying people on their backs to make money. At the end of the day, Garganta has made money, but all Condorito's passengers were police, students, or other people with free passes.
